results.headline: India Election Defies Expectations for Modi and BJP Landslide
results.summary: Remember all the predictions that Narendra Modi’s party was on track for a landslide? Oops!

results.headline: Marcelo Claure-Backed Fund Seeks Saudi Cash for Brazil Deals
results.summary: A Brazilian investment firm backed by billionaire Marcelo Claure is in talks with Saudi investors to launch a $600 million fund as it targets the climate and energy sectors in Brazil.

results.headline: Brazil Economic Rebound Faces Risks, Giving Lula Reason to Worry
results.summary: Once again, the Brazilian economy started the year with a bang, beating forecasts and giving President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva reason to celebrate. This time around, the win is likely to be far less enduring.

results.headline: Modi’s Magic Is Fading Fast. Who’s India's Next Leader?
results.summary: The prime minister may well come back, but he no longer has an iron grip on power.

results.headline: Lula Aims to Offset Costly Tax Break, Keep Fiscal Goal in Reach
results.summary: Brazil’s government said it will issue a provisional measure to offset the cost of a contentious payroll tax break as it seeks to keep the benefit from derailing efforts to hit its primary fiscal target this year.

results.authors: By John Liu, Jing Li, and Josh Xiao
results.headline: China Says Its Ukraine Plan Has Backing After Summit Snub
results.summary: China’s top diplomat said more than two dozen countries have expressed backing for Beijing’s vision to resolve the Russia-Ukraine conflict, days after China indicated it will skip an upcoming peace summit in Switzerland.

results.headline: Ukraine Summit Opens Door to Limited Future Talks With Russia
results.summary: A Swiss-hosted summit on Ukraine will aim to carve a path to involving Russian officials in future talks after establishing agreement on nuclear safety, food security and returning abducted children, a draft document shows.

results.authors: By Daniel Ten Kate, Philip Heijmans, and Anna Edgerton
results.headline: Trump’s Persecution Claims Get Boost from US Adversaries
results.summary: After Donald Trump’s felony conviction last week, commentators in China and Russia wasted little time in trumpeting the failure of American democracy.

results.headline: Sabesp Sets Rules for Second Phase of Privatization in Brazil
results.summary: Sao Paulo’s state government unveiled more details of its plan to privatize Latin America’s largest water utility, aiming to complete the equity offering in the third quarter.

results.headline: Climate Change Made Deadly Brazil Floods Twice As Likely, Study Finds
results.summary: The torrential rain in Rio Grande do Sul state was more apt to happen because of global warming.
